noun.description: A thing said or done for amusement; a joke.
examples: there are jests about administrative gaffes

verb.description: Speak or act in a joking manner.
examples: “I don't know about maturing,” jests William

origin: Late Middle English: from earlier gest, from Old French geste, from Latin gesta actions, exploits, from gerere do. The original sense was heroic deed, hence a narrative of such deeds; later the term denoted an idle tale, hence a joke.
